articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel said on Thursday there would be no humanitarian exceptions to its siege of the Gaza Strip until all its hostages were freed.
articles.title: Israel and Hamas at war: Latest News

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Human Rights Watch on Thursday accused Israel of using white phosphorus munitions in its military operations in Gaza and Lebanon, saying the use of such weapons puts civilians at risk of serious and long-term injury.
articles.title: Human Rights Watch says Israel used white phosphorus in Gaza, Lebanon

articles.author: Layli Foroudi, Antonia Cimini
articles.description: French police used teargas and water cannon to break up a banned rally in support of the Palestinian people in Paris on Thursday after the interior minister said such gatherings were "likely to generate disturbances to public order".
articles.title: France uses teargas, water cannon on banned pro-Palestinian rally in Paris

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick, Patricia Zengerle, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Despite Israeli bombardment that has brought Gaza to the brink of a humanitarian meltdown, U.S. President Joe Biden is facing little pressure at home to rein in Israel's military retaliation for an unprecedented attack by Palestinian Hamas militants.
articles.title: Analysis: In Gaza crisis, Biden faces little pressure to rein in Israel - for now

articles.author: Anthony Deutsch, Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: The International Criminal Court has jurisdiction over potential war crimes carried out by Hamas militants in Israel and Israelis in the Gaza Strip, even though Israel is not a member state, the ICC's top prosecutor told Reuters on Thursday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Hamas attack would fall under jurisdiction of war crimes court -prosecutor

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian said on Thursday that the continuation of crimes against Palestinians will receive a response from "the rest of the axis" and Israel will be responsible for the consequences.
articles.title: Iran says crimes against Palestinians to receive response from axis

articles.author: Tim Reid, Nathan Layne
articles.description: Israel and the White House on Thursday condemned remarks by Donald Trump in which he praised the Iran-backed militant group Hezbollah and criticized Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu over an attack by Palestinian Hamas militants that killed more than 1,300 people in Israel.
articles.title: Israel, White House condemn Trump for remarks about Hamas attack, 'smart' Hezbollah

articles.author: Henriette Chacar, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Israel's military chief said "Now is the time for war" as his country amassed tanks near the Gaza Strip ahead of a planned ground invasion to annihilate the Palestinian militant Hamas group that rules the enclave and was behind deadly weekend attacks.
articles.title: UN says Israel wants 1.1 million Gazans moved south

articles.author: Sabine Siebold, Andrew Gray
articles.description: Defence ministers at NATO's Brussels headquarters watched stunned as their Israeli counterpart Yoav Gallant on Thursday showed them "shocking" and "horrific" video from the Hamas attack on Israeli civilians, diplomats said.
articles.title: NATO ministers shown 'horrific' video from Hamas attack

articles.author: David Morgan, Moira Warburton
articles.description: Representative Steve Scalise, who Republicans picked to be the next speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives, dropped out of the race on Thursday as his party failed to resolve its divisions, sending the chamber into its 10th day without leadership.
articles.title: US House speaker nominee Scalise drops out of race, deepening crisis
